clamp.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to put or hold something in a position so that it cannot move
clamp.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She clamped her hands over her ears.
Creed opened his mouth to speak, then clamped it shut.
clamp.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to hold two things together using a clamp
clamp.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Clamp the two parts together until the glue dries.
clamp.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to put a clamp on the wheel of a car so that the car cannot be driven away. This is usually done because the car is illegally parked
clamp.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He returned, only to discover his car had been clamped.
clamp.translation[0].definitions[2].note: Clamp is usually passive in this meaning
clamp.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a piece of equipment for holding things together
clamp.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a metal object that is fastened to the wheel of a car so that the car cannot be driven away. This is usually done because the car is illegally parked
